means: （使某物）发出叮当声( clank的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Our chains are forged ! Their clanking may be heard on the plains of Boston!
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的枷锁已经铸成, 锒 铛的镣铐声在波士顿的平原上可清晰听闻!

sentence.Network_en: Their clanking may be heard on the plains of Boston!
sentence.Network_cn: 它们的当啷声将在波士顿平原上响起!

sentence.Network_en: The clanking tractor went along , shooting smoke out of its belly.
sentence.Network_cn: 拖拉机铿铿地开了过去, 从车肚里喷出烟来.

the reporter is optional collect a bundle , although not have " brave words " , however also bone clank , show the Communist's loyalty .记者随意拾取一束，虽无“豪言壮语”，却也铁骨铮铮，显出共产党人的赤胆忠心。

entry.tran: (巨大金属物)发出咣当声，发出当啷声
entry.def: When large metal objects clank, they make a noise because they are hitting together or hitting against something hard.

example.ex: 'Here we are now,' Beth said, as the train clanked into a tiny station.
example.tran: 火车咣当咣当进了小站，“我们到站了，”贝丝说。

means.word_mean: 1. having a hard nonresonant metallic sound;

sentences.sentence: "the clanking arms of the soldiers near him"

auth_sentence.content: Some undergraduates came clanking through in football boots.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some undergraduates came clanking through in football boots.

auth_sentence.content: I then heard the sounds of clanking and exploding for five to six minutes.

auth_sentence.content: In the distance I heard an early train clanking along the branch line towards London.
